resources.string:
Overviews of top tournament and ranked matches currently being played and recently finished. Live matches are delayed just like in the Dota 2 spectator client.

 Tournament matches show the pro teams' names instead of "Radiant" and "Dire". Live ranked matches are sorted by average MMR and pro players are highlighted with a distinct color. Recent matches are sorted by time finished (most recent at the top of the list).

 Swipe down to refresh the according list. Swipe left and right to switch between live and recent matches. Click once on a match to show or hide additional information. Press and hold on a ranked match to switch between pro players' official names and current Steam names.

 To spectate a live match, find it in the "Watch" tab in your Dota 2 client. Alternatively, type the command below a live match into your Dota 2 console and press Enter.

 Click on the OpenDota or Dotabuff button below a recent match to view their specific match details in your browser.

This app is being developed and maintained by a small group of amateur and professional developers. We came together through a post on /r/dota2. You can follow the development and see the whole source code here.
We started this app in the hopes of learning more about Android development. It has been quite a journey already and we are always looking to learn more by implementing new things.

The current state of the app is not the final result of this project. We are always looking for feedback, especially related to the UI. If you have any suggestions or bug reports, please let us know here by creating a new issue.
App needs permission to access the current network state!
App needs permission to connect to the internet!
Network error. Please check your internet connection
